Summary I'm an operations and support specialist with over two decades of experience in managing products, leading teams, and overseeing the client experience. I’m technically minded, and have worn several hats in my past roles; including product manager, webmaster, and graphic designer. I have an old-fashioned work ethic, an eye towards improving existing systems, and empathy with the customer’s needs. 
 
What have I done? 
 
Created documentation for training, client education, and product implementation. 
Worried out new product features from existing internal tools and products. 
Resolved hundreds of customer issues via email support. 
Acted as a go-between for operations, product teams, and engineering. 
Supported products as diverse as online maps, media storefronts, and education programs. 
 
What can I do? 
 
CREATE: organizational systems for tracking and documentation. 
MANAGE: people, teams, tasks, and products. 
DOCUMENT: policies, processes, and training materials. 
RECRUIT: interview candidates and evaluate team members. 
EDUCATE: train and onboard team members. 
 
Now seeking growth opportunities in nurturing environments, with passionate people and rewarding products. Summary Michiko Lynn Powers is a Learning & Design Specialist at Google, and manages Google's internal learning content. Prior to her current role, she was a senior user education specialist at Google, and actively supported global users through eLearning and various user education initiatives for Google’s flagship consumer products including Search, Images, and Maps.  
 
Prior to Google she was the Product Manager at Gazillion Entertainment (SmartyCard.com). She defined quantifiable business justification and determined the functional requirements for SmartyCard's new features and enhancements. She created dynamic prototypes and detailed specifications of interaction and functional aspects of the product design.  
 
In 2008 she earned her Master's degree from the Learning, Design and Technology Program (LDT) in Education at Stanford University where she gained in-depth knowledge of how to assess and design an theoretically-informed and empirically-grounded framework for learning environments and products that effectively utilize emergent technology in a variety of settings. 
 
Prior to her graduate work, Lynn ran the daily operations of Powerful Concepts, LLC., a boutique production consultancy. From 2002 and 2005, she was an animation producer for a variety of leading animation titles at Geneon Entertainment, a subsidiary of Dentsu. 
 
Lynn received her BA in Political Science at Amherst College in 2002, where she was a prestigious Uchimura Kanzo Scholar. She also received a BA in 1998 in English and American Studies from Kansai Gaidai University in Osaka, Japan. In 1996, she had the pleasure of attending Växjö University in Växjö, Sweden where she studied Swedish language and Scandinavian literature. 
 
Lynn is a native of Japan and speaks Japanese, English and Swedish.
